column4: someone knows of a utility that can read s.m.a.r.t data from a file?
you can't read SMART data from a file.. but the utility smartctl will give you the info for a drive.
i have the data in a file
if you can't read it with a text file i'm not sure what smart data you have..
what i see generally looks like:  http://www.3ware.com/kb/attachments/smartmonexampleoutput.txt
i get the status, temp etc.
the tools report on only one drive at a time, maybe that's why
/dev/twa0 is the raid controller, or the virtual device the system sees that array as, I suppose.
twa0 would be the unit on the controller :)
yeah, but twa0 represents more than one drive.. thats's what the /device=3ware,1 ,2 is about
yeah twa0 is the raid unit, and the --device=3ware,[N] would be the port on the controller and the disk attached to the [N] port :)
